# Technical requirements

::: callout-warning
DISCLAIMER: This book contains information relevant exclusively for the internal Technical team of the PIP project. It has been made available to the public for the sake of transparency, but its information has no use outside the internal team.
:::

## This book

For contributions to this Manual, visit the [Github repository for this book](https://github.com/PIP-Technical-Team/PIPmanual) and clone the dev branch.

Notice that each .qmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading `#`.


## PIP R packages

Make sure to install the latest version of PIP R packages by typing the following:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ipkg <- utils::installed.packages()[,1]

pip_install <- function(pkg, ipkg) {
  if (isFALSE(pkg %in% ipkg)) {
    gitcall <- paste0("PIP-Technical-Team/", pkg)
    remotes::install_github(gitcall, dependencies = TRUE)
    TRUE
  } else {
    FALSE
  }
}

pkgs <- c("pipload", "pipaux", "wbpip", "piptb", "pipdm", "pipapi")


purrr::walk(pkgs, pip_install, ipkg = ipkg)
```
:::


## PIP Stata wrapper

Make sure to install the [latest version](https://github.com/worldbank/pip/releases) of the PIP API Stata wrapperndefined by typing the fo

``` stata
net install github, from("https://haghish.github.io/github/")
github install worldbank/pip
```

For more information, visit the [Github Repository](https://github.com/worldbank/pip) for this wrapper.
